item.title: Artsida 6 Auction
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]The 6th Artsida event is a fundraiser for AIDS Community Care Montreal, a volunteer-based community organization working to enhance the quality of life of people living with HIV/AIDS, to prevent HIV transmission, and to promote community awareness and action. For more background about ACCMâs signature art auction, check out Artsida History. Artsida returns for its much-anticipated sixth edition on Wednesday September 30th, 2015. Artsida has become an important event on the social calendar for art admirers and philanthropists who wish to make a difference in the community. This yearâs remodeled event, held at the stunningly restored EntrepÃ´ts Dominion, will take new directions that will solidify Artsidaâs position as an essential pillar of Montrealâs cultural circuit. Outstanding works from leading and emerging artists will not only inspire you to connect with captivating art but also to our compelling cause. Exciting raffle prizes will also be available, such as two WestJet round trip tickets to anywhere in North America or Europe! Stay tuned for announcements about other prizes. Come join us and Raise your Hand for ACCM! Where: EntrepÃ´ts Dominion, 3968 St-Ambroise When: Wednesday, September 30th 2015 Time: 5pm-10:30pm

5-6pm: VIP Cocktail

  • Meet selected artists
  • Exclusive complimentary wine bar
  • Exclusive cocktail dinatoire & hors dâoeuvres

6-6:30pm: General Cocktail

  • Complimentary wine bar
  • Cocktail dinatoire & hors dâoeuvres

6:30-9pm: Live Auction

9-10:30pm: Dessert and Coffee Lounge

Pour plus de renseignements sur lâencan phare dâACCM, consultez la section Historique dâArtsida. Artsida, qui revient pour une sixiÃ¨me Ã©dition trÃ¨s attendue le mercredi 30 septembre prochain, sâest taillÃ© une place de choix sur le calendrier dâactivitÃ©s sociales des amateurs dâart et des philanthropes soucieux dâamÃ©liorer les choses dans la collectivitÃ©. Artsida se tiendra aux EntrepÃ´ts Dominion, un espace magnifiquement restaurÃ©, et adoptera cette annÃ©e une formule repensÃ©e ainsi quâune nouvelle direction qui lui permettront dâasseoir sa rÃ©putation Ã  titre dâÃ©vÃ©nement incontournable de la scÃ¨ne culturelle montrÃ©alaise. Les Åuvres exceptionnelles dâartistes rÃ©putÃ©s et dâartistes Ã©mergents vous feront dÃ©couvrir un art captivant et vous en apprendront davantage sur la cause qui nous tient Ã  cÅur. Des prix attrayants seront tirÃ©s, dont deux billets WestJet aller-retour pour nâimporte quelle destination en AmÃ©rique du Nord ou l'Europe! Surveillez nos prochaines communications pour en savoir plus sur les autres prix. Joignez-vous Ã  nous, et levez votre main pour ACCM! LieuÂ : EntrepÃ´ts Dominion, 3968, rue St-Ambroise DateÂ : Mercredi 30 septembre 2015 HeureÂ : 17h00 - 22h30

17h00 - 18h00Â : Cocktail VIP

  • Rencontre avec certains des artistes
  • AccÃ¨s gratuit et exclusif au bar Ã  vin

item.title: Volunteer
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]

Volunteers are an important part of Artsida and there are a lot of ways to get involved!

Volunteers offer support on the event night by staffing the bar, the door, and the art packing station, as well as showcasing the art during the auction. Volunteers are also involved in the months leading up to the event by offering support in areas like social media and sponsorship development.

If you're interested in getting involved or want to hear more about our many volunteer opportunities please contact our Volunteer Coordinator, Andrea Kornacki, at volunteer@accmontreal.org or (514) 527-0928.

[:fr]

Les bÃ©nÃ©voles jouent un rÃ´le clÃ© dans le succÃ¨s dâArtsida; il existe de nombreuses faÃ§ons de participer!

Le soir de lâÃ©vÃ©nement, les bÃ©nÃ©voles peuvent apporter un appui au bar, Ã  lâaccueil et au poste dâemballage, ainsi que prÃ©senter les Åuvres pendant lâencan. Au cours des mois prÃ©cÃ©dant lâÃ©vÃ©nement, les bÃ©nÃ©voles participent aussi aux activitÃ©s relatives aux mÃ©dias sociaux et aux commanditaires.

Si vous souhaitez participer ou en savoir plus sur les nombreuses occasions de bÃ©nÃ©volat, communiquez avec Andrea Kornacki, coordonnatrice des bÃ©nÃ©voles, Ã  lâadresse volunteer@accmontreal.org ou au 514-527-0928.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]

Artsida 6 will be hosted by two Honorary Co-Chairs who will represent ACCMâs commitment to the struggle against HIV as well as its involvement in the Montreal contemporary art scene. The Honorary Co-Chairs will be revealed soon.

item.title: Artsida History
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]

Artsida was originally launched as Project HOPE in late 2006 when founder Chris Elliott was looking for an opportunity to assist ACCMâs crucial work in the HIV/AIDS community.

What began as a small fundraising effort to promote local artists and HIV/AIDS awareness soon took on more dynamic proportions by drawing the attention of celebrities such as Susan Aglukark, Joe Average, Tom Bianchi and Sharon Stone.

Galerie Dentaire agreed to host the Artsida exhibit for three weeks in 2008, which solidified a partnership that continues to this day. The auction itself has been held at renowned venues across Montreal, such as the Cabaret Lion dâOr, the St James United Church and the Montreal Contemporary Art Gallery. It has grown from raising $15,000 in its first iteration to $55,000 at Artsida 5.

Throughout the years, Artsida has featured works donated by the stars of the QuÃ©bec and Canadian art scenes, such as Kent Monkman, Daniel Barkley, Marie Danielle Leblanc, Yvon Goulet, Zilon, Scarlett Raven (a celebrated member of Damien Hirstâs Young British Artists group), and international artists including Christopher Campbell (Saatchi member - UK); Irish artist Karl Mullen (Polk Museum), and American artist Ryan Cronin (Greenfield Foundation); as well as talented emerging QuÃ©becois artists like Steve LÃ©vesque, SÃ©bastien Astwo, Jean Pascal Fournier, Annie Langlois and Marie HÃ©lÃ¨ne Bellavance (acclaimed star of Sophie Deraspeâs film Vital Signs).

[:fr]

Artsida a dâabord vu le jour sous le nom de Projet Espoir Ã  la fin deÂ 2006 alors que Chris Elliott, son fondateur, cherchait un moyen dâappuyer le travail essentiel dâACCM auprÃ¨s des personnes touchÃ©es par le VIH-sida.

Ce qui Ã©tait au dÃ©part une simple activitÃ© de financement visant Ã  promouvoir les artistes locaux et Ã  sensibiliser le public Ã  la question du VIH-sida a rapidement pris de lâampleur en attirant lâattention de cÃ©lÃ©britÃ©s comme Susan Aglukark, Joe Average, Tom Bianchi et Sharon Stone.

En 2008, la Galerie Dentaire a acceptÃ© de prÃ©senter lâexposition Artsida pendant troisÂ semaines, Ã©tablissant ainsi un partenariat qui perdure encore aujourdâhui. Lâencan a Ã©tÃ© tenu dans des endroits connus de MontrÃ©al tels que le cabaret Lion dâOr, lâÃglise unie Saint James et la Galerie dâarts contemporains. La cinquiÃ¨me Ã©dition dâArtsida a permis dâamasser 55 000 $, alors que la premiÃ¨re Ã©dition avait recueilli 15 000 $.

Au fil des ans, lâexposition Artsida a prÃ©sentÃ© des Åuvres offertes par de grands noms des scÃ¨nes artistiques quÃ©bÃ©coise et canadienne comme Kent Monkman, Daniel Barkley, Marie Danielle Leblanc, Yvon Goulet, Zilon et Scarlett Raven (membre rÃ©putÃ©e du groupe des Young British Artists de Damien Hirst), ainsi que par des artistes dâautres pays comme Christopher Campbell (membre de Saatchi â Royaume-Uni), lâartiste irlandais Karl Mullen (Polk Museum) et lâartiste amÃ©ricain Ryan Cronin (Greenfield Foundation). Sur la scÃ¨ne quÃ©bÃ©coise, des artistes Ã©mergents talentueux comme SÃ©bastien Astwo, Jean Pascal Fournier, Annie Langlois et Marie-HÃ©lÃ¨ne Bellavance (dont la performance dans le film Les Signes vitaux de Sophie Deraspe a Ã©tÃ© saluÃ©e) figurent aussi parmi les donateurs.

[:]

item.title: Event Venues
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]

EntrepÃ´ts Dominion (main auction)

Les EntrepÃ´ts Dominionâs stunning architectural design was awarded the Special Jury Prize (Prix spÃ©cial du jury) by CrÃ©ativitÃ© MontrÃ©al in 2007. Construction of the beautiful heritage building began in 1880 by the Merchants Manufacturing Company as the neighbourhood became an industrial centre in Canada with several sawmills, flourmills, tanneries and smelters. Not too far from the Atwater Market, easily accessible by metro and equipped with plenty of parking, the elegantly remodeled building makes the perfect backdrop for this major art event.

Galerie Dentaire (vernissage)

Galerie Dentaire is a unique and offbeat amalgamation of an art gallery and dental clinic that has been hosting Artsidaâs immensely popular art exhibitions since 2008. Situated a few steps from Sainte-Catherineâs street, it has become a focal point for Montreal art openings and cultural events.[:fr]

EntrepÃ´ts Dominion (encan principal)

Le bÃ¢timent des EntrepÃ´ts Dominion a reÃ§u le prix spÃ©cial du jury CrÃ©ativitÃ© MontrÃ©al en 2007 pour son design architectural remarquable. Lâentreprise Merchants Manufacturing Company a entamÃ© la construction de cet Ã©difice historique en 1880 Ã  lâÃ©poque oÃ¹ le quartier devenait lâun des centres industriels du Canada en raison de ses multiples scieries, moulins Ã  farine, tanneries et fonderies. Ã proximitÃ© du MarchÃ© Atwater, facilement accessible en mÃ©tro et dotÃ© dâun vaste stationnement, le bÃ¢timent Ã©lÃ©gamment restaurÃ© est lâendroit tout indiquÃ© pour la tenue de ce grand Ã©vÃ©nement consacrÃ© Ã  lâart.

Galerie Dentaire (vernissage)

Proposant le concept unique dâune fusion entre une galerie dâart et un cabinet de dentiste, la Galerie Dentaire accueille les expositions trÃ¨s courues dâArtsida depuis 2008. SituÃ©e Ã  quelques pas de lâavenue Sainte-Catherine, elle est devenue un endroit incontournable Ã  MontrÃ©al pour les vernissages et les Ã©vÃ©nements culturels.[:]

item.title: Auction Rules
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]

Conditions Of Sale

Live Auction

In order to make bids, all bidders must fill in a Paddle Registration Form at the Registration Desk before the start of the live auction. Keep in mind that all artworks are subject to a reserve bid, a confidential amount that must be met for the lot to be sold. If your bid is successful, you must go to the Payment Desk before the end of the evening to pay by cash, Interac or by credit card. Title to the offered lot will then pass to you, and you will thereupon assume full risk and responsibility for the work purchased by you. If you are unable to pay at the conclusion of the auction, ACCM reserves the right to offer the art to the previous bidder if they are able to pay for it.

In the event of any dispute between bidders, a missed bid or doubt as to the validity of any bid, the auctioneer will have, at his discretion, the final authority either to determine the successful bidder or to re-offer and resell the work in dispute.

If any dispute arises after the auction, the Artsida record of the auction proceedings shall be conclusive.

General Rules For Live Auction

All sales are final. No purchase can be returned, refunded or exchanged. All property is sold as is, as exhibited. If the final purchase price is equal to or greater than 120% of the estimated value, the purchaser will be issued a charitable tax receipt for the difference between the estimate and the selling price.

Successful bidders should be prepared to pay for their purchases with cash, Master Card, Visa, or Interac on the evening of the auction. No GST, QST or auction commission is applicable.

Artsida reserves the right to withdraw any work of art at any time before the actual sale.

ACCM makes no warranties or representation of any kind or nature with respect to any work of art including, but not limited to, any representation or warranty of description, genuineness, attribution, provenance, or physical condition, nor as to the right of reproduction, if any. Bidders and purchasers may not rely upon any statement, oral or otherwise, other than that set forth in these conditions of sale.

Pick Up

All works must be paid for at the conclusion of the auction evening. Purchasers must pick up works at the conclusion of the auction evening upon proof of payment. Transportation may be arranged, at the purchaserâs expense. ACCM is not responsible for acts or omissions of carriers or packers of purchased lots, whether or not recommended by ACCM. Packing and handling of purchased lots are at the entire risk of the purchaser.

Absentee Bidding

If you live outside of Montreal or are unable to attend the event, absentee bids can be placed by filling out the Absentee Registration Form. All Absentee Registration Forms must be e-mailed to artsida@accmontreal.org before 11:59PM on Sunday September 27th, 2015. All bids will be accepted and executed, subject to the terms and conditions of sale.

In the event of identical bids, the earliest received bid will take precedence.

Successful bidders will be notified, and purchase will be charged to your MasterCard or Visa as indicated on your completed form.

[:fr]

Conditions de vente

Vente aux enchÃ¨res en direct

Pour miser, tous les enchÃ©risseurs doivent remplir le formulaire dâinscription pour une palette Ã  la Table dâInscription avant le dÃ©but de la vente aux enchÃ¨res. Gardez en tÃªte que tous les Åuvres sont assujettis Ã  un prix de rÃ©serve, un prix confidentiel sous lequel le lot ne sera pas vendu. Si votre mise gagne, vous devez vous prÃ©senter Ã  la Table des Paiements pour payer avec une carte de crÃ©dit ou en comptant avant la fin de la soirÃ©e. Le titre de propriÃ©tÃ© du lot offert vous sera ainsi transmis, et vous acceptez dÃ¨s lors tous les risques et lâentiÃ¨re responsabilitÃ© de lâÅuvre que vous avez achetÃ©e. Si vous Ãªtes incapable de payer Ã  la fin de la vente aux enchÃ¨res, ACCM se rÃ©serve le droit d'offrir l'art Ã  lâenchÃ©risseur prÃ©cÃ©dent si cette personne est en mesure de payer.

En cas de diffÃ©rend entre deux enchÃ©risseurs, de mise perdue ou de doute quant Ã  la validitÃ© de toute mise, lâencanteur aura, Ã  sa discrÃ©tion, l'autoritÃ© finale de dÃ©terminer lâenchÃ©risseur gagnant ou dâoffrir Ã  nouveau et de revendre lâÅuvre faisant lâobjet du diffÃ©rend.

En cas de diffÃ©rend survenant aprÃ¨s la vente aux enchÃ¨res, les registres dâArtsida quant au dÃ©roulement de la vente aux enchÃ¨res seront dÃ©terminants.

RÃ¨gles gÃ©nÃ©rales pour la vente aux enchÃ¨res

Toutes les ventes sont finales. Aucun achat ne pourra Ãªtre retournÃ©, remboursÃ© ni Ã©changÃ©. Tous les biens sont vendus en lâÃ©tat, tels quâexposÃ©s. Si le prix final d'achat est Ã©gal ou supÃ©rieur Ã  120% de la valeur estimÃ©e, un reÃ§u d'impÃ´t pour activitÃ©s de bienfaisance sera remis Ã  l'acheteur pour la diffÃ©rence entre la diffÃ©rence entre la valeur estimÃ©e et le prix de vente.

Les enchÃ©risseurs gagnants doivent Ãªtre prÃªts Ã  payer leurs achats, le soir de lâenchÃ¨re, en argent comptant, MasterCard, Visa, ou Interac.

Les soumissionnaires retenus pour en ou la vente aux. Pas de La TPS, la TVQ ni aucune commission ne seront appliquÃ©es.

Artsida se rÃ©serve le droit de retirer toute Åuvre d'art Ã  tout moment dâici la rÃ©alisation de la vente.

ACCM nâoffre aucune garantie ni reprÃ©sentation de quelque sorte que ce soit en ce qui concerne toute Åuvre d'art y compris, sans s'y limiter, toute reprÃ©sentation ou garantie ayant trait Ã  la description, au caractÃ¨re authentique, Ã  lâattribution, Ã  la provenance, Ã  la condition physique ni au droit de reproduction, le cas Ã©chÃ©ant. Les enchÃ©risseurs et lâacheteur ne peuvent se fier Ã  aucun Ã©noncÃ©, oral ou autre, de Sida BÃ©nÃ©voles MontrÃ©al, Ã  lâexception de ce qui est Ã©noncÃ© dans les prÃ©sentes conditions de vente.

Prise de possession

Toutes les Åuvres doivent Ãªtre payÃ©es Ã  la fin de la soirÃ©e de la vente. Les acheteurs doivent prendre possession des Åuvres Ã  la fin de la soirÃ©e de la vente sur prÃ©sentation dâune preuve de paiement. Du transport peut Ãªtre organisÃ©, au frais de lâacheteur. ACCM nâest pas responsable des actes ou des omissions des transporteurs ou emballeurs des lots achetÃ©s, quâil les ait ou non recommandÃ©. Lâemballage et la manutention des lots achetÃ©s se font aux risques de l'acheteur.

Ordres dâachat

Des ordres dâachat peuvent Ãªtre faits par ordre d'achat enregistrÃ©, le formulaire sera disponible bientÃ´t. Tous les ordres d'achat doivent Ãªtre reÃ§us avant 23h59, dimanche le 27 septembre 2015. Tous les ordres dâachat seront acceptÃ©s et mis en Åuvre sous rÃ©serve des conditions de vente.

En cas de mises identiques, lâordre dâachat reÃ§u en premier aura prÃ©sÃ©ance.

Les enchÃ©risseurs gagnants seront avisÃ©s et lâachat sera portÃ© Ã  leur carte Mastercard ou Visa comme indiquÃ© sur le formulaire rempli.

item.title: AIDS Community Care Montreal (ACCM)
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]Founded in 1987, ACCM is QuÃ©becâs only English language AIDS service organization and provides support and services in English and French. ACCM is a volunteer-based community organization working to enhance the quality of life of people living with HIV/AIDS, to prevent HIV transmission, and to promote community awareness and action. We provide practical as well as psychosocial support for people living with HIV, and offer treatment conferences dealing with HIV medication regimens. We also facilitate education and prevention outreach to at-risk communities in Montreal.Â Our services are accessed by hundreds of people every year, and we strive to break down the social stigma and isolation that can affect people living with HIV.

[:fr]FondÃ©e en 1987, ACCM ( AIDS Community Care Montreal ) est le seule organisme communautaire anglophone du QuÃ©bec qui fournit un soutien et des services en anglais et franÃ§ais aux personnes vivant avec le VIH-sida. ACCM est un organisme qui sâappuie sur le travail de bÃ©nÃ©voles et travaille Ã  lâamÃ©lioration de la qualitÃ© de vie des personnes qui vivent avec le VIH-sida, Ã  la prÃ©vention de la transmission du VIH et Ã  la promotion de la sensibilisation et de l'action communautaire. Nous fournissons des conseils pratiques ainsi que le soutien psychosocial pour les personnes vivant avec le VIH. Nous facilitons Ã©galement l'Ã©ducation, et la prÃ©vention Ã  des communautÃ©s Ã  risque Ã  MontrÃ©al et nous offrons des confÃ©rences de traitement portant sur une variÃ©tÃ© de sujets complexes. Nos services sont utilisÃ©s par des centaines de clients chaque annÃ©e et nous travaillons fort pour lutter contre la stigmatisation sociale et l'isolement qui peuvent affecter les personnes vivant avec le VIH.

[:]

item.title: Submissions
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]Thank you for your interest in submitting artwork for Artsida 6 and for supporting ACCMâs mission! The art submission process is in two steps :
  1. Complete submission form on this website (click button below);
  2. Email a high-resolution 300 dpi colour image of your artwork to submissions@accmontreal.org. Please put your full name and artwork title in the email subject.
Submission deadline: July 1st 2015, at 11:59pm. Each artist is allowed to submit a maximum of two pieces for consideration. If you are submitting two pieces, submit each piece separately using this on-line form. Pieces submitted for the auction must remain available for Artsida until the artist is informed of the Curatorial Committeeâs decision in early July 2015. If the piece is no longer available, the artist may submit a substitute piece but the Committee is not obligated to accept it. The Curatorial Committee will set the estimated market value of submitted artwork, taking into consideration the proof of estimated value provided by the artist upon selection. The artist agrees to donate their artwork to Artsida, even if the piece is not sold at or above the reserve bid price. ACCM reserves the right to try to sell the piece by other means after the main event, all the while respecting the conditions of sale as established by the artist. Upon selection, the artist agrees to provide the following documentation before July 31st to Artsida:
  1. Artist Contract;
  2. Proof of the estimated market value;
  3. Download Certificate of authenticity.
The artist may choose to email all 3 required documents during the submissions process, along with the image of the artwork. We will accept the following two types of proof of estimated market value:
  1. A copy of an invoice or receipt of sale, preferably recent, of a similar piece of art (of similar medium and format);
  2. If the artist is represented by a gallery, a copy of the gallery's official price list for the artist's works.
More details about the certificate of authenticity will be available soon. The artist assumes the responsibility to deliver the artwork to Artsida before July 31st. Out-of-town artists must organize and cover the cost of shipping the artwork to Artsida.

Art Submission Form

[:fr]Merci de votre intÃ©rÃªt Ã  prÃ©senter une Åuvre pour ArtsidaÂ 6 et de votre appui Ã  la mission dâACCM! La prÃ©sentation dâune candidature comporte deux Ã©tapesÂ :
  1. Remplissez le formulaire de candidature situÃ© sur le site (cliquez sur le bouton ci-dessous).
  2. Faites parvenir une image couleur haute rÃ©solution de 300 ppp (dpi) en mode de votre Åuvre Ã  lâadresse submissions@accmontreal.org. Veuillez inclure votre nom complet et le titre de votre Åuvre dans lâobjet du courriel.
Date limite pour la prÃ©sentation des candidaturesÂ : 1er juillet 2015, Ã  23h59. Les artistes peuvent soumettre deux Åuvres tout au plus. Le cas Ã©chÃ©ant, les Åuvres doivent Ãªtre soumises sÃ©parÃ©ment au moyen du formulaire en ligne. Les Åuvres prÃ©sentÃ©es doivent rester disponibles en vue de lâencan Artsida jusquâÃ  ce que lâartiste ait Ã©tÃ© informÃ© de la dÃ©cision du comitÃ© de sÃ©lection au dÃ©but de juillet 2015. Si lâÅuvre nâest plus disponible, lâartiste peut en soumettre une autre, mais le comitÃ© nâest pas tenu de lâaccepter. Le comitÃ© de sÃ©lection Ã©tablira la valeur marchande estimÃ©e de lâÅuvre prÃ©sentÃ©e en se fondant sur la preuve quâaura fournie lâartiste Ã  cet Ã©gard au moment de la sÃ©lection. Lâartiste consent Ã  donner son Åuvre Ã  Artsida mÃªme si celle-ci nâest pas vendue Ã  un prix Ã©gal ou supÃ©rieur au prix de dÃ©part. ACCM se rÃ©serve le droit dâessayer de vendre lâÅuvre par dâautres moyens aprÃ¨s lâÃ©vÃ©nement principal tout en respectant les conditions de vente Ã©tablies par lâartiste. Lâartiste dont lâÅuvre a Ã©tÃ© sÃ©lectionnÃ©e consent Ã  fournir les documents suivants Ã  Artsida avant le 31Â juilletÂ :
  1. Contrat de lâartiste
  2. Preuve de la valeur marchande estimÃ©e
  3. TÃ©lÃ©charge Certificat dâauthenticitÃ©
Lâartiste peut choisir dâenvoyer les 3 documents requis avec lâimage de lâoeuvre par courriel durant la pÃ©riode de soumission. Pour la preuve de la valeur estimÃ©e, nous accepterons les 2 options suivantes:
  1. Une copie de facture or reÃ§u de vente, prÃ©fÃ©rablement rÃ©cent, d'une oeuvre de format et mÃ©dium similaire;
  2. Si l'artiste est reprÃ©sentÃ©(e) par une galerie: une copie de la liste de prix officielle de la galerie pour l'artiste.
Plus de dÃ©tails sur le certificat d'authenticitÃ© seront bientÃ´t disponibles. Lâartiste sâengage Ã  remettre son Åuvre Ã  Artsida avant le 31 juillet. Les artistes qui ne rÃ©sident pas Ã  MontrÃ©al doivent faire acheminer lâÅuvre Ã  Artsida et assumer les coÃ»ts qui en dÃ©coulent.

item.title: Artsida 6 Vernissage & Art Sale
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded:
[:en]

The Artsida 6 vernissage will provide an opportunity for the public to meet the artists, as well as preview the collection before it goes to auction. Held at the unique and singular Galerie Dentaire on Saturday September 19th 2015, this free gallery exhibition will include additional artwork on sale exclusively for the night of the vernissage. This is a great chance to come check out the art up close and pass an enthralling evening with wine and hors dâoeuvres.

Where: Galerie Dentaire, 1200 Amherst
When: Saturday, September 19th 2015
Time: 5-10pm
Free entry

[:fr]

Dans le cadre du vernissage de la sixiÃ¨me Ã©dition dâArtsida, le public pourra rencontrer les artistes et admirer la collection avant lâencan. Tenue le samedi 19Â septembre prochain dans ce lieu unique quâest la Galerie Dentaire, lâexposition gratuite prÃ©sentera aussi dâautres Åuvres en vente uniquement le soir du vernissage. Il sâagit dâune excellente occasion de venir Ã©tudier les Åuvres de prÃ¨s et de passer une soirÃ©e captivante tout en dÃ©gustant du vin et des hors-dâÅuvre.

LieuÂ : Galerie Dentaire, 1200, rue Amherst
DateÂ : Samedi 19 septembre 2015
HeureÂ : 17Â h-22Â h
Admission gratuite

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: FR: An American artist and social activist whose work responded to the New York City street culture of the 1980s by expressing concepts of birth, death, sexuality, and war. Haring's work was often heavily political and his imagery has become a widely recognized visual language of the 20th century.

item.title: Mobile Lovers
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded: [:en]Mobile Lovers, showing a couple embracing while checking their phones, sold to collector with all proceeds going to club which faced closure.[:fr]DO NOT DO THIS!!! Mobile Lovers, montrant un couple enlacÃ© tout en vÃ©rifiant leurs tÃ©lÃ©phones, vendus au collecteur et toutes les recettes au club qui faisait face Ã la fermeture.[:]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Banksy is a pseudonymous English graffiti artist, political activist, film director, and painter.His satirical street art and subversive epigrams combine dark humour with graffiti executed in a distinctive stencilling technique. His works of political and social commentary have been featured on streets, walls, and bridges of cities throughout the world. Banksy's work grew out of the Bristol underground scene, which involved collaborations between artists and musicians. Observers have noted that his style is similar to Blek le Rat, who began to work with stencils in 1981 in Paris. Banksy says that he was inspired by "3D", a graffiti artist who later became a founding member of Massive Attack, an English musical group.

[:en]EN: Established by the artist in 1989, the Keith Haring Foundation perpetuates Haring's artistic and philanthropic legacy through the preservation and circulation of his artwork and archives, and by providing grants to children in need and those affected by HIV/AIDS.[:fr]FR: Established by the artist in 1989, the Keith Haring Foundation perpetuates Haring's artistic and philanthropic legacy through the preservation and circulation of his artwork and archives, and by providing grants to children in need and those affected by HIV/AIDS.[:]

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Survival Virus de Survie 9th annual report, installation view 2
item.dc:creator: Shawn.Thompson
item.content:encoded: [:en]EN: The video contains all the serial numbers of all the canadian bills infected by the SVdS project. The wall paper is xeroxed copies of the notebooks of the project. The wood blocks represent the actual physical space of the project, they are stacks of (from left to right) $2, $5, $10, $20, $50 and $100 that went into the process of the project.[:fr]FR: The video contains all the serial numbers of all the canadian bills infected by the SVdS project. The wall paper is xeroxed copies of the notebooks of the project. The wood blocks represent the actual physical space of the project, they are stacks of (from left to right) $2, $5, $10, $20, $50 and $100 that went into the process of the project.[:]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [:en]EN: Mathieu is self-taught, and has been presenting his installation work since the mid-90s. He also practices intervention, performance and publishes multiples. wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [:en]EN: Cheryl Kolak Dudek is an artist, professor and writer whose practice includes printmaking, drawing, painting and digital technologies. After writing a dissertation on contemporary narrative forms in the work of Nancy Spero, Philip Guston and Ida Applebroog, she has been creating serial imagery in digital media. She is presently the principal researcher for an interdisciplinary team project titled: Grammatical, Interactive Systems for Generative Design. This multi year research project will develop computational methodologies to identify, analyze and interpret the geometric designs of cultural artifacts for the purpose of generating contemporary designs and artwork in new media technologies. Her work is funded by the FQRSC (Quebec), SSHRC (Canada) and Hexagram: Institute for Research and Creation in the Media Arts, where she is a member of the Advanced Digital Imaging and Rapid Prototyping axe of research. [:fr]FR: Cheryl Kolak Dudek is an artist, professor and writer whose practice includes printmaking, drawing, painting and digital technologies. After writing a dissertation on contemporary narrative forms in the work of Nancy Spero, Philip Guston and Ida Applebroog, she has been creating serial imagery in digital media. She is presently the principal researcher for an interdisciplinary team project titled: Grammatical, Interactive Systems for Generative Design. This multi year research project will develop computational methodologies to identify, analyze and interpret the geometric designs of cultural artifacts for the purpose of generating contemporary designs and artwork in new media technologies. Her work is funded by the FQRSC (Quebec), SSHRC (Canada) and Hexagram: Institute for Research and Creation in the Media Arts, where she is a member of the Advanced Digital Imaging and Rapid Prototyping axe of research. [:]
